channel.title: Minecraft - Pocket Edition (android)
channel.description:
MC Pocket Edition has now been opened up to all android devices. Originally posted into the market for the Xpheria Play, this is a mobile version of minecraft for android devices. There is a paid version ($6.99USD) or a demo (see link below). The demo is limited to 18 of 36 blocks, and cannot save world's. The map generation takes a little bit on my phone with a 1GHz processor and 339MB of RAM. The game runs smoothly although the controls took a bit to get used to. Hold down to destroy a block or tap to destroy.
Demo: https://market.android.com/details?id=com.mojang.minecraftpe.demo&feature=more_from_developer

item.title: Minecraft - Pocket Edition (android)
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Spankr Poodle:

I downloaded the full version. I like it. That’s really all I have to say. It is just like classic mode, but on the phone.

With the addition of torches and a small “durability” to blocks. But yes, classic MC through and through. Its a long ways though for being a mobile phone.

Read full topic

item.title: Minecraft - Pocket Edition (android)
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:2, topic:417376”]I don’t condone piracy but protip: pirate it

Look’s like quite a lot of fun but unfortunately it doesn’t run on any ARMv6 cpu phones which means my Orange San Francisco (ZTE Blade) will not run it

I’ve always found Minedroid pretty cool, but it’s only a map viewer![/quote]
Lol there is a demo to test compatibility and everything. I may purchase it or may not. Haven’t really decided but I was it to at least hit alpha v1.5+ before I even think about getting the full version.

Read full topic
